channel.title: Code, beer, and limited legroom
channel.description: Photo journal of a Creative Front-end Developer from New Zealand living and working in Europe

item.title: Oslo
item.description:
After enjoying Copenhagen so much we were really keen to check out Oslo. It’s a quiet city, but has some lovely culture: Great coffee, good craft beer scene, lots of shuffle board tables… and crazy expensive pricing!

Skål!
K

item.title: Champagne
item.description:
A lovely late-summer long weekend touring Champagne! Was a trip full of great wine, food, and sunshine.

Santé!
K

item.title: Scotland
item.description:
Four awesome days travelling through rural Scotland. Started in Edinburgh then drove west. Stopped in at Loch Lomond and Luss, had a gorgeous sunny drive through Glen Coe where we stayed the night. Day two we hit Glenfinnan and various parts of Skye before stopping in Portree. Day 3 more of Skye before heading south to Newtonmore, staying the night in Kingussie. Final day was spent slowly making our way back down to Edinburgh, and a mandatory stop at Dalwhinnie.

Slàinte!
K

item.title: Lisbon
item.description:
Spent a lovely 4 days in Lisbon for Easter, such a treat. Lisbon is beautiful, really interesting architecture, loads of colour and texture, great weather, delicious wine and charcuterie and cheese and Pasteis de Nata!

Exploring the main part of town on foot is an excellent experience. Further west in Belem are some interesting architectural sights, the tower, the bridge, the monastery and the gorgeous modern art museum make for a great day trip.

One of our favourite trips we’ve taken in Europe, a really really really cool experience.

Saude!
K

item.title: North Wales
item.description:
After a few months in London since Christmas, Krysten and I were really keen to get out of the city for a weekend. North Wales was a great choice! Rocky, rolling hills, castles, sheep, mist, and sleepy old resort towns.

We hired a car and drove down from Liverpool through Snowdonia National Park, spent a night in Caernarfon, and returned via the coast to see Conwy and Llandudno.

The castles are incredible, and they’re littered all over North Wales! The highlight though was our amazing meal at Blas in Caernarfon, stunning.

Iechyd da!
K

item.title: Slovenia
item.description:
Krysten and I spent an absolutely epic weekend in Slovenia. This place is so underrated! What an incredible hidden gem in Europe. One of the most beautiful places we’ve seen. It has 50% dense forest cover over the entire country and is super lush. It’s quiet and sleepy, even in the main city Ljubljana. We covered it by car which we’d highly recommend. Going in October worked out great, it was a bit drizzly, but that full gamut of leaves and those misty hills are hard to beat.

Na zdravje!
K

item.title: Naples and Pompeii
item.description:
Our final stop in what was busy 2 weeks in Italy. Napoli is quite different to the other cities we saw. It’s a bit more rough around the edges, but still has it’s own charm. Mount Vesuvius offers a pretty neat view, and Pompeii is absolutely incredible. It’s worth coming to Italy just to see Pompeii, what a treasure of human history. We unfortunately didn’t have enough time to see all of it! We’ll be back.

Salute!
K

item.title: Rome
item.description:
Oh Rome, the home of European civilization and Catholicism. How cool to finally see these famous places, buildings, and historic artifacts in person. There’s more ruins than you can shake a stick at; almost every block has something fascinatingly old. It’s a little bit overwhelming. The Vatican Museum houses an incredibly large collection of priceless pieces, I especially enjoyed seeing the ancient Egyptian items. A strong display of power and wealth.

Salute!
K

item.title: Florence and Tuscany
item.description:
From Venice we caught a train to Firenzie. Staying in the hills 20m north we had some great views. Florence is a neat city, it was the epicentre of art during the renaissance and has many masterpieces to show for it. Amazing marble buildings, the Santa Maria del Fiore is a spectacular sight.

Also spent a day seeing Tuscany: Siena, San Gimignano and Pisa. Really beautiful rolling hills, vineyards, stone buildings, 32 degree weather, awesome.

Salute!
K

item.title: Venice
item.description:
Stop two, Venezia! A massive tourist playground, but also incredibly beautiful.

Venice is outrageously photogenic, there’s colours and textures and water and bridges and boats and narrow alleys everywhere. Even with all of the people around you can somehow stumble upon these beautiful empty spaces.

Salute!
K
